p: The consumption of monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFAs) is associated with the maintenance of body weight and a reduction in central adiposity, resulting in a lower risk of developing obesity [ 9]. Of the MUFAs, oleic acid is the major fatty acid found in olive oil, the main component of the Mediterranean diet, which has rapid absorption in the body and shows a hypocholesterolemic effect [ 10]. Like the MUFAs, the polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) also lower low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) and promote the stabilization of atherosclerotic plaque [ 11].
